review_title: Great professors to work alongside with
pros: Great opportunities -- you must be proactive. If you want to do research, approach the relevant professor, and discuss your options.
cons: The largest con is low pay.

pros: Great work environment..great department leadership and collaboration
cons: There really are no cons

pros: Loved my time working at Wittenberg. The students and staff had great, positive energy!
cons: Salaries were low starting out.

pros: • Developed conflict management skills • Received diversity and inclusion training • Gained many marketable skills
cons: • Not many, just based on the community you are placed in!

review_title: Pay is low, but working with students is rewarding
pros: Working with students is rewarding.
cons: Pay is low compared to other colleges and universities.

pros: Good benefits, higher than average pay, beautiful campus, located central to Springfield, safe environment, opportunities for growth, education opportunities, development, supports, flexibility
cons: Toxic work environment, political, bureaucratic, staff that needs to retire won't, difficult environment when considering needed changes and operational direction, mismanaged in some departments, territorial, hostile at times.

pros: Amazing staff members as coworkers
cons: Minimum wage, required night hours, discriminatory higher ups

job_title: Student Office Worker in Springfield, OH
pros: Amazing peers and supervisors that push you to be the best!
cons: I do wish I could get more hours but it is a good fit for me for also being a full time student.

pros: Flexible to busy schedules, meet lots of different people, help others find answers to math problems.
cons: I have no cons for this job.

pros: Supporting Liberal Arts Education for the next generation
cons: 9 hours from my home in Virginia

pros: Mission, student centered, traditional liberal arts
cons: Limited mobility, urban area, small endowment

pros: It is a great place to work love it so much. Best place to work.

review_title: Hagen Center is a great place to learn and work
pros: Lots of learning and mentoring opportunities
cons: Low pay, but it’s a student position

job_title: Assistant Athletic Trainer in Springfield, OH
pros: Athletic facilities, Red Chairs throughout campus
cons: Campus maintenance, dorm maintenance, change of leadership

review_title: Wittenberg is a very good institution to work for, cares for its students, but should pay adjuncts more
pros: Wittenberg promotes an atmosphere of collegiality and everyone is helpful.  There is a focus on teaching students and promoting undergraduate research.   Recent changes in administration are looking positive to improving Wittenberg's standings and attractiveness
cons: Like similar colleges, Wittenberg has to struggle to bring in sufficient funds and paying students to meet program needs and therefor doesn't provide the pay or raises that would appropriate.  There is a quest for the programs and niche that will attract more and better students.  While most of the faculty are full time, terminal degree and adjuncts used when necessary, adjuncts are underpaid

pros: This is a wonderful place to work..... great benefits, nice people, a very open environment to voice your opinions and concerns. The students are very considerate, and everyone in general are just very nice and helpful, especially if you are "new" to Witt.
cons: This is nothing against Witt in general, but I just had a very bad shift (3rd), and NEVER got any weekends off. If they had come up with a better schedule, and rotated weekends, I would still be there !!!  I absolutely loved working here, with the exception of my schedule.

job_title: Research Intern in New Carlisle, OH
pros: This was a good place to work and it led to a lot of good experiences. I liked working for my professor and assisting him with his research. I had flexible hours with my heavy work load which was nice
cons: I do not believe there were any cons to this job. I was a sophomore so the work I was doing was about as had as I could have handled and the hours were great

pros: Wonderful people, engaged staff, being a student worker
cons: Little possibility of career progress at the University due to the nature of student jobs.

pros: Wittenberg University is a great institution with fantastic students, faculty and staff. Everyone is friendly and an over-achiever.
cons: They are currently facing some budget issues, so I hope that gets straightened out

review_title: Easy to get student works hours
pros: Has many options for student jobs, usually pay above minimum wage, flexible hours,
cons: tough competition, not very much upward mobility, but of course they are student jobs

pros: Great community, very welcoming and helpful. Students are quality
cons: Currently going through restructuring; job security is not promised.

review_title: Great institution, Great People, Low pay
pros: Faculty and staff are genuine and passionate about the students.
cons: HR is a little old school in process.

• Great work environment

cons: The pay setup is poorly done and if not done correctly you will not get paid
